Hamid Rather

Cryogenics | Data | Design

ABOUT ME

ABOUT

Hey there! I am Rather Hamid, a graduate student, aerospace engineer, and researcher from Germany.

MS Student @ Universität Bremen

I am pursuing a Master of Science (MS) with a concentration in the design, integration, and analysis of aerospace systems at Universität Bremen and hold a Bachelor of Science in Aerospace Engineering. I am currently a Student Researcher in the Fiber, composites & cryogenics lab. In this role, I design and integrate test equipment for cryogenic materials, and crucially, I also develop and automate the data analysis pipelines for these experiments. I use Python, Pandas, Plotly, other libraries and PowerBI to process, analyze, and visualize the test results, turning raw sensor data into actionable insights for material selection.

Sports: Camping, Volleyball, and Fitness

Hobbies: Reading technical papers and exploring new technologies

My current work as a Student Researcher at Faserinstitut Bremen is focused on materials for next-generation propulsion. I am designing and building test stands to analyze how composite materials and adhesives behave in cryogenic environments, specifically for hydrogen fuel tanks. This role combines hands-on design and simulations with hardware integration. A key part of this role is developing the Python-based data workflows to process and analyze the permeation test results, turning raw sensor data into meaningful insights.

CAREER

  • Professional Experience
  • Education

Werkstudent @ Faserinstitut Bremen

Developing and automating data analysis pipelines in Python (Pandas, Matplotlib) to process and visualize experimental data from materials science research.

My work supports high-profile projects like HyTank (an Airbus project) and WaGuPa, focusing on materials for cryogenic liquid hydrogen (LH2) storage.

Designed, built, and commissioned a high-pressure helium permeation test stand, integrating all hardware, sensors, and DAQ systems from the ground up.

Conducting cryogenic material characterization for the HyTank project, including tensile tests on composites submerged in liquid nitrogen (−196°C).

Performing coupled Ansys (CFD) simulations for material analysis in composite tank structures.

Aug. 2023 - Present
Werkstudent

Studentische_hilfskraft - Resiliente Energiesysteme @ University of Bremen

Developed and implemented mathematical models in Python in Python to simulate and analyze complex, resilient energy systems for the HyBit project.

Focused on the modeling and simulation of electrochemical systems, such as hydrogen electrolyzers and fuel cells, to understand their behavior within a larger grid.

Conducted energy system analysis by testing the models against four different power input data sets representing various renewable electricity supply scenarios.

My work directly supported the techno-economic assessment of these hydrogen systems.

Utilized libraries like Pyomo, SciPy, Pandas, etc to build and run the simulations.

Aug. 2023 - March 2024
Studentische_hilfskraft

Werkstudent - Flight Demonstrator Assembly & Component Testing @ Polaris Spaceplanes

CAD modelling, assembly, integration and testing of flight demonstrator parts

Development of Python post-processing libraries and data infrastructure

Core team member for the MIRA II, the world's first aerospike rocket plane, supporting its assembly from the ground up.

Integrated all major vehicle systems, including structural components, avionics, and the AS-1F aerospike rocket engine.

Co-built and integrated the LOX/Kerosene engine test stand and actively participated in the aerospike hot-fire test campaigns.

Designed and 3D printed flight components, and was responsible for soldering and processing the entire vehicle's cable harnesses.

Analyzed all flight and engine test data using Python to validate performance

Aug. 2023 - Jan. 2024
Werkstudent

Rocket Propulsion Test Data Intern @ Rocket Factory Augsburg

Rocket engine hot-fire and cold-flow test data analysis using Python (numpy, scipy, pandas)

Visualization using matplotlib and plotly

Automatic detection of test parameters and spectral analysis

Documentation of test results

Used test data to develop and improve Python models for engine performance estimation and behavior prediction.

Automated a key in-house test procedure using Python, which was "previously processed manually". I developed the script for automatic parameter detection in pressure drop tests.

Interpreted data and provided active, actionable advice to test engineers after analyzing hot-fire and cold-flow tests.

Performed spectral analysis (FFT, PSD, spectrograms) on high-frequency data from vibration sensors.

Supported the propulsion and operations team in all pre- and post-test activities.

Jan. 2023 - Apr. 2023
Data Intern - Propulsion Test Data

Propulsion & Design Intern @ SpanTrik

Design, manufacture and analysis of a sounding rocket (RAVEN)

Propulsion system testing and documentation

Worked in cross-functional team under project deadlines

Sep. 2021 - Dec. 2021
Propulsion & Design Intern

Student Researcher (Werkstudent) | Advanced Computational Laboratory, SRM Institute

Oct. 2018 - Jun. 2020
Werkstudent (Advance Computational Laboratory)

ECHO: Enhanced Communication Hearing Oscillator

Overview

ECHO bracelet has three features to help those who are hard of hearing including a metronome, morse code translator, and music interpreter

Details

The ECHO bracelet is an innovative assistive device designed to improve communication accessibility for individuals with hearing impairments. It combines three distinct features: a metronome for rhythm-based communication, a morse code translator for text-to-vibration conversion, and a music interpreter that translates musical patterns into haptic feedback.

Technologies

  • Arduino
  • C++
  • Haptic Feedback
  • Bluetooth

Key Features

  • Real-time morse code translation with haptic feedback
  • Adjustable metronome with customizable vibration patterns
  • Music interpretation algorithm for melody-to-vibration conversion
  • Low-power wireless connectivity
View Project GitHub

Balhalla: Viking Dodgeball

Overview

Balhalla is a viking-themed .IO game of dodgeball developed with an emphasis on 3D FPS accessibility for lower-performance devices and a focus on fun gameplay over graphical fidelity

Details

Balhalla brings the excitement of dodgeball to a Viking-themed online multiplayer arena. Built with performance optimization in mind, the game delivers smooth 3D FPS gameplay even on lower-spec devices. The game prioritizes engaging mechanics and competitive gameplay while maintaining accessibility across a wide range of hardware.

Technologies

  • Unity 3D
  • C#
  • WebGL
  • Multiplayer Networking

Key Features

  • Optimized 3D rendering for low-end devices
  • Real-time multiplayer dodgeball mechanics
  • Viking-themed characters and environments
  • Browser-based gameplay via WebGL
View Project GitHub

Designing for Life

Overview

Look into the life & legacy of Bonnie Cashin, a pioneer in practical fashion, through an immersive virtual exhibition curated with high interactivity, concurrent visitors, and cross-platform compatibility in mind

Details

An interactive digital exhibition celebrating Bonnie Cashin, one of the most influential designers in American fashion history. This virtual museum experience combines educational content with engaging multimedia presentations, allowing visitors from around the world to explore Cashin's revolutionary contributions to practical fashion design.

Technologies

  • Three.js
  • WebGL
  • JavaScript
  • Responsive Design

Key Features

  • Interactive 3D gallery environment
  • Multi-user concurrent viewing experience
  • High-resolution fashion archive imagery
  • Cross-platform compatibility (desktop, tablet, mobile)
View Project GitHub

Rocket Project at UCLA

Overview

Rocket Project at UCLA is a student engineering team that teaches rocket engineering through hands-on exposure to the complete design-build-test cycle of engineering

Details

A comprehensive student-led engineering program focused on aerospace education. Team members gain practical experience in all aspects of rocketry, from initial design and simulation through manufacturing, testing, and launch operations. The program emphasizes interdisciplinary collaboration and real-world engineering practices.

Technologies

  • CAD (SolidWorks)
  • MATLAB
  • Computational Fluid Dynamics
  • Manufacturing

Key Features

  • Full rocket design cycle from concept to launch
  • Hands-on manufacturing and fabrication experience
  • Flight simulation and trajectory analysis
  • Team-based engineering project management
View Project GitHub

Red Horizon Scare

Overview

Rocket adventure game where the player must survive the interplanetary trek from Earth to Mars and back with features such as bump mapping, collision detection, and physics-based simulation

Details

An immersive space adventure game that challenges players to navigate the dangerous journey between Earth and Mars. Featuring realistic physics simulation, detailed 3D graphics with advanced rendering techniques, and engaging gameplay mechanics that combine exploration, resource management, and survival elements.

Technologies

  • Unity 3D
  • C#
  • Physics Simulation
  • Shader Programming

Key Features

  • Realistic orbital mechanics and physics simulation
  • Advanced bump mapping and shader effects
  • Collision detection and debris avoidance
  • Resource management gameplay
View Project GitHub

Form Factor

Overview

Improving accessibility to better physical health through the use of an Arduino-based networked embedded system that corrects workout form

Details

Form Factor is a smart fitness assistant that uses sensor technology and machine learning to provide real-time feedback on exercise form. The system helps users maintain proper posture and technique during workouts, reducing injury risk and improving exercise effectiveness through immediate corrective guidance.

Technologies

  • Arduino
  • IMU Sensors
  • Machine Learning
  • Wireless Communication

Key Features

  • Real-time posture and form analysis
  • Immediate corrective feedback via audio/haptic alerts
  • Exercise tracking and progress monitoring
  • Networked multi-device support
View Project GitHub

Smart Home Automation

Overview

IoT-based home automation system enabling remote control and monitoring of household devices through a centralized web and mobile interface

Details

A comprehensive home automation solution that integrates various IoT devices and sensors to provide seamless control over lighting, climate, security, and entertainment systems. The platform features real-time monitoring, automated scheduling, energy consumption tracking, and voice control integration for a truly smart home experience.

Technologies

  • Raspberry Pi
  • Python
  • MQTT Protocol
  • React Native

Key Features

  • Multi-device integration and control
  • Real-time sensor monitoring and alerts
  • Automated scheduling and scene creation
  • Energy usage analytics and optimization
View Project GitHub
